dataservice-summary.noDataServiceImportMsg: You can also import an existing Data Service. To import an existing Data Service, click Import Data Service below.

dataservice-documentation.connecting-heading1: There are multiple ways to connect to your data service including JDBC, ODBC, and OData. Several code samples are provided below, which demonstrate how you can connect to your data service from different client applications. For more information about the supported access methods, see the Client Developers Guide. In the Client Developers Guide you can find specific support information for JDBC, ODBC and OData.
dataservice-documentation.connecting-java: JDBC  To connect to your service using JDBC, use the following connection string in your client: {{connection_string}}
dataservice-documentation.connecting-odata: OData  Deployed services are accessible using OData URLs. This service is accessible via: {{url}}.
dataservice-documentation.java-instructions: This Java code sample shows how to connect and query the data service from a java client. You must include the Teiid driver jar file in your client's classpath. See JDBC Support in the Client Developers Guide for more information.
dataservice-documentation.javascript-instructions: This Javascript code sample uses jquery to retrieve an OData result set. See http://jquery.com for details. The OData URL is protected using HTTP Basic security - the user is required to have a role of 'odata' defined for access.
dataservice-documentation.node-instructions: This node.js code sample uses the o.js javascript library available for node. See http://www.npmjs.com/package/odata for details. The OData URL is protected using HTTP Basic security - the user is required to have a role of 'odata' defined for access.
dataservice-documentation.python-instructions: This Python code sample queries the data service via the OData URL. You will need to update the username and password in the provided code. The OData URL is protected using HTTP Basic security - the user is required to have a role of 'odata' defined for access.
dataservice-documentation.php-instructions: This PHP code sample uses curl to query the data service via the OData URL. The appropriate Base64 encoded authentication string will need to be added in the provided code. The OData URL is protected using HTTP Basic security - the user is required to have a role of 'odata' defined for access.

dataservice-test.enterQueryMsg: Enter an SQL query to test the Data Service
dataservice-test.failedDeploymentMsg: The Data Service could not be deployed:
dataservice-test.selectResultLimitMsg: Select the number of results to be initially returned
dataservice-test.selectViewMsg: Select the view to be queried
dataservice-test.selectViewPlaceholder: Select a view in the list...

help.endpointSubmit:
'

This URL is formed using the OData specification. It can be copied into a new browser window to return the results in xml format or append ?format=json to the URL for JSON.

Click the Submit button to display the results in a formatted table.

'
help.select:
'

Choose the view from which results should be sought.

Select a limit to curtail the number of results returned

'
help.columns: Select the columns to be included in the results.
help.where:
'

Create where clauses for filtering the results based on the values in each tuple.

Use the + button to add new where clauses (clauses are and-ed together) and remove them with the - buttons.

'
help.orderBy: Sort the results by column in ascending or descending order.
help.resultsTable:
'

Use the column headers to sort the results or filter them by entering values.

Results are paginated in blocks of 25 and can be scrolled through with the controls at the foot of the table.

'
help.resultsRaw:
'

The raw data as returned from the odata teiid service in json format.

'
help.sqlSearch:
'

Use the Teiid dialect of SQL to construct a query that interrogates the data service for data results.

Use the record limit to limit the number of results returned.

Set the starting record index to fetch a subset of results starting at the given row index.

'
